alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Logan County; Morgan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 11 at 3:56AM MST until December 14 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...POTENT WINTER STORM HEADED FOR THE REGION... .A strong winter storm system will move into the Great Basin tonight, and then track toward southeast Colorado Monday night, and then lift northeast into Nebraska by Tuesday. This track means that significant travel impacts will be possible especially over portions of the northeast plains of Colorado into adjacent western Nebraska and parts of eastern Wyoming. Blizzard or near blizzard conditions may develop over the eastern plains of Colorado as the storm intensifies late Monday night and Tuesday. Strong winds are expected to gust to 50-60 mph, and combined with falling snow create blizzard conditions. There is still considerable uncertainty with regard to eventual storm totals and exactly how far east or west the heavier snow on the plains will be. Thus, anyone planning to travel or those with outdoor livestock interests should pay particular attention to the latest winter storm watches, warnings, and statements from the National Weather Service and your local news media. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Tuesday evening. Some light snow, blowing snow, and gusty winds may linger into Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Visibility may be near zero at times due to snow and blowing snow, resulting in whiteout conditions. Travel may be treacherous and road closures will be possible.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
